content: Hi all, preview of the new Variant guidance is up on https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/branches/variant-component-groups/sequencing.html, please review and comment here or on https://docs.google.com/document/d/15g1rngmgFoE8_i7UGpXRpISkOCrd1QCoQBg9REY80EI/edit#heading=h.66b6emu5lnph
@Jamie Jones - The google doc still has 3 ways of defining a variant, but the sequencing page only shows 2? Did you decide to remove 'by providing a specific code in a variant database' ?
Yes, @Bob Dolin suggested on call last week that we don't reinforce that pattern, especially since we aren't binding the component to a particular database
I'll make the change in the doc as well
Did we also discuss leaving off the compound het section?

I'd like to go over that section and review our current examples: https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/branches/variant-component-groups/Bundle-compound-heterozygote.html and https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/branches/variant-component-groups/Bundle-complexVariant-nonHGVS.html
@Jamie Jones I really like what you've done with the page. Thanks. Minor question, did you mean to leave out "Outer and/or inner end should be populated"?
Bob Dolin good catch I'll clean that up

@Bob Dolin wondering if we can revert to https://loinc.org/81301-4/ and https://loinc.org/81302-2/ for inner and outer start-end now that we are clearly treating variants with those populated as structural
I kinda remember the history - we had quit using those codes because they had 'structural' in the name? If so, yes, I'd agree with you.
To clarify, the variant guidance branch is to change the main IG not create a second IG? so the LOINC code changes will be part of the main IG. Are these breaking changes?
Not a new IG, no. So any code changes would be breaking. However, STU2 will have numerous other breaking changes.
